Why is the price of icETH sometimes less than ETH?

The market volatility in 2022 has created a short-term price differential between stETH and ETH, where stETH is worth less than ETH. 

Since icETHâ€™s underlying holding is stETH, the price of $icETH is also impacted. https://t.co/Y0qRO87Aer

5/18 

How does $icETH's yield accrue?

The yield denominated in $stETH auto-compounds and accrues to the position in @AaveAave, and this gain in yield is reflected in the price of the icETH token. 

Over time, the value of icETH should be greater than stETH & ETH. https://t.co/1LBh0pVbNb

4/18 

How does $icETH work?

icETH deposits stETH into @AaveAave. Then wETH is borrowed on Aave until it reaches the desired multiple. 

Next, the loaned wETH & the userâ€™s initial deposit are exchanged for stETH. The total stETH, minus the fee, is deposited back into the Aave. https://t.co/PKS1AJDVUC

3/18

Where does the yield come from?

icETH enhances ETH staking rewards via an automated leveraged liquid strategy. 

The composability of @LidoFinance's $stETH & @AaveAave makes it possible for icETH to construct this yield strategy in an ERC-20 token.

https://t.co/xOTIEV7K6B

6/ Index Coop products are accessible and simple to use

By abstracting away active management from sophisticated crypto strategies by consolidating them into simple ERC-20 tokens, Index Coop products make it simple for ordinary people to get exposure to the best of DeFi. https://t.co/rF8oJG1s74

5/ Index Coop products are immutable and built on smart contracts

Our products are built using audited smart contracts

Smart contracts abstract away most human involvement & prevent negligent or malicious actors from meddling in product operations

ğŸ”—: https://t.co/k6j2I9ZSNz

4/ Index Coop products are verifiably liquid

Liquidity requirements are an essential component of the inclusion criteria for our products

When redeeming, quoted prices will be accurate and users will face minimal slippage

Example for our upcoming Diversified Staked ETH Index https://t.co/yZthuuzV9k

3/ Index Coop products are permissionlessly redeemable for the underlying tokens

This allows arbitrageurs to keep our products in-line with Net Asset Value (NAV) & also ensures the token will hold value regardless of secondary liquidity conditions on the market

2/ Index Coop products are fully collateralized

Digital assets within @IndexCoop products exist on-chain, meaning they are held in smart contracts 1:1. 

You can review the smart contracts behind Index Coop products below

Contract Addresses: https://t.co/UX2pUGiH15

This is a challenging moment for our industry.

Many are disheartened by the apparent lack of risk management and irresponsible business practices at Alameda and FTX.

We clearly and transparently acknowledge risks.

As with any digital asset, our products are not without risk. We acknowledge the risks associated with owning our products on each of our product pages on our website.

Automated risk management is built into our products via smart contracts.

Many of our products have automated risk management built-in rebalancing and reweighting, automatically preparing our users for the most turbulent market changes.

Our products are fully on-chain and transparent 24/7.

Product holders can view their holdings at any point with proof of collateral. Proof of reserves are guaranteed and are not manually reported but rather available on-chain for anyone to audit.

All of our assets are self-custodied. We do not have the ability to move, alter or otherwise transact with userâ€™s funds.

Users always have the ability to permissionlessly withdraw their funds.
We'd also like to take this opportunity to articulate what separates DeFi, @IndexCoop and our products from centralized actors like FTX:

For those who hold $INDEX or our strategy tokens, we want to make it clear that @IndexCoop has no connection to FTX.

Our balance sheet does not have any exposure to $FTT or assets custodied by FTX, and @IndexCoop operations will not be affected by recent events.

If you haven't been following, you can read an overview of what happened from @Coindesk below.

Our thoughts are with those who have been impacted by these events. https://t.co/3FVmj3TI9v

A statement from @IndexCoop on recent market events:

The collapse of centralized exchange @FTX_Official this week has shaken the cryptocurrency industry. Markets are trading down, and many are suffering steep losses.

When Will A Positive APY Return?

One event that could potentially stabilize a positive APY is the Ethereum Merge, which is expected to occur on September 13th, 2022. 

Debt positions on Aave related to ETH â€œfork farmingâ€ will need to be repaid and will likely occur post-Merge.

Over the past two months, icETH has outperformed both ETH and stETH.

Holders are still earning positive interest on icETH relative to ETH, but for the time being, interest earned is less than holding stETH. https://t.co/klHigEcrOk

In the lead-up to the Merge, ETH lending protocols are experiencing a *significant* increase in ETH borrowing. 

While rates earlier in August hovered at ~1.8%, theyâ€™ve gone up ~4x to 7.38% at the time of writing.

How ETH Borrow Rate Affects icETH

$icETH's strategy creates a positive APY when the stETH rewards rate exceeds the Aave ETH borrow rate.

On August 31st, the @AaveAave ETH borrow rate eclipsed the stETH rewards rate for the first time, resulting in a negative APY for icETH

Until further notice, Index Coop has suspended the icETH streaming fee to 0%

One aspect of The Merge is that investors will be able to stake ETH, and earn interest in the form of staking rewards on their asset. Based on an investors assessment of the future value of ETH, that investor could earn more ETH by staking

3. Energy consumption will be reduced after The Merge ğŸ”‹

The Merge will reduce the energy necessary to run the Ethereum network by up to 99.95%

This turns ETH into a very environmentally friendly investment, which is obviously popular

2. It may be easier to value ETH more accurately âš–ï¸

This new monetary/issuance policy also makes possible more traditional valuation techniques like Discounted Cash flows due to clarity around future issuance and burning of $ETH

1. A new issuance policy could make ETH deflationary ğŸ¦‡ğŸ”Š

The new issuance policy of Ether, coupled with EIP1559, which took effect in mid-2021, can make Ether deflationary, or at least disinflationary.

What is Perpetual Protocol?

@perpprotocol is an on-chain decentralized exchange for perpetual futures, made possible by a Virtual Automated Market Maker. Using perpetual contracts, users can open leveraged long or short trading positions for a variety of assets.

A perpetual contract is a special type of futures contract, but unlike traditional futures, it does NOT have an expiry date.

For context, a futures contract is an agreement to buy or sell a commodity, currency, or another instrument at a predetermined price in the future.

$MNYe contains a fully hedged $ETH position, with equivalent spot exposure and short exposure via perps

IIP-57: Launching iETH-FLI - The Ethereum Inverse Flexible Index

A passing vote here signals the Index Coop's intent to further research iETH-FLI feasibility resulting in a product prioritization score.

IIP-66: Smart Contract Engineer Offer - Full Time offer

After conducting a recruitment process for a new Smart Contract Engineer, this IIP is to confirm @ncitron into the position.

IIP-67: Delegate UNI to Flipside for Community-Enabled Analytics

This is a proposal to delegate a number of Index Coop-controlled UNI votes to allow Flipside to formally propose Community-Enabled Analytics for UNISWAP

IIP-68: Delegate Aave to EOA Address

This IIP requests authorization for Index Coop to delegate all of DPIâ€™s Aave voting rights to an EOA. This is intended to be for the sole purpose of submitting an AIP and for voting on listing DPI as collateral on Aave V2.

IIP-69: Update Funding Council Wallet Signers

This is a proposal to update signers on the Funding Council Wallet to replace signers @asoong & @setoshi with @darkforestcapital & @gregdocter.

Additionally, this IIP will change the multisig minimum signer threshold from 1/3 to 2/3

IIP-70: Create a Stablecoin Reserve Within the Operations Account

This IIP proposes the creation of a $500k stablecoin reserve held within the Operations Account. This will come from the existing $7.8mm in USDC. $250k will be converted into DAI.

âš ï¸WARNING: The BTC2x-FLI Supply Cap has been hit.âš ï¸

Premiums may develop on secondary markets as more people buy and additional supply is not produced.

Please be careful when buying on DEXes or through aggregators! You can see the premium on Index Coop or Tokensets websites.

9/

How are we going to avoid this in the future?
 
There is a proposal to delegate decision-making on FLI parameters to a team that can respond more rapidly to market changes
 
Going forward, the supply cap and other relevant parameters will be tracked and updated proactively

8/

Holders have two options: 

1) They can sell the ETH2x-FLI product on @Uniswap  and buy back in when the supply cap has been increased 

2) They can hold onto the product and see if the premium will diminish due to NAV increases

7/

What should current holders do and what happens when the cap gets lifted?

If one were to have purchased the ETH2x-FLI product when there was a premium (anytime over the past week since the supply cap was reached), they will experience a loss when the price returns to NAV

6/

What are we doing about it?

A proposal to increase the supply cap of ETH2x-FLI is currently being voted on

If passed, the upper limit of available tokens will be lifted and the price will return to the NAV as more supply enters secondary markets

https://t.co/djOMJw3oKs

5/

A supply cap was agreed upon in order to ensure a safe rollout of the product (because ETH2x-FLI is the first leveraged product of its kind)

Because we have reached the supply cap, the arbitrage bots that have been deployed are unable to mint new tokens and increase supply

4/

This is what is currently happening with FLI. The price on @Uniswap is $134.09, but the NAV on TokenSets is $119.71, which represents a premium of ~10%

In order to minimize departure from the NAV, arbitrage bots are deployed to mint new supply in response to demand

3/
 
When ETH2x-FLI tokens are traded on secondary markets (@Uniswap , @loopringorg ), the price can deviate from the NAV if enough buyers in the market want to own it

They may be willing to pay more than what itâ€™s intrinsically worth, causing the price to rise above the NAV

2/

Whatâ€™s going on?

The price of ETH2x-FLI is currently trading at a premium on secondary markets because demand from buyers exceeds supply

Why?

Ideally, the price of an ETH2x-FLI token is equivalent to a proportional share of underlying assets - cETH holdings minus USDC debt

1/

We recognize that there is frustration with the lack of communication over the ETH2x-FLI breaking its peg to NAV over the past week

We at Index Coop commit to sharing developments about our products more frequently and in real-time going forward

4/ ğŸ’µ Costs ğŸ’µ

FLI's flexible algorithm substantially reduces rebalancing costs, and gas costs are aggregated across users - lowering fee burdens.

3/ âš ï¸ Safety âš ï¸

FLI floats within a target leverage ratio range utilizing a recentering mechanism.

It is designed to absorb major volatility spikes and flexibly rebalance to ensure that collateral levels stay above liquidation thresholds. https://t.co/kLxXOyOB2o

@compoundfinance 5/ (3) the sender must request the returns within 6 months, and (4) a 10% penalty will be imposed. Otherwise, the funds will be considered community assets.

@compoundfinance 4/ The proposal suggests that every 6 months, the sweeper is used to retrieve funds that were accidentally locked in a ctoken contract. Requirements are (1) only amounts >1000$ will be retrieved, (2) the sender must verify his identity through a signature (or on-chain call data)

4/ What a Methodologist needs to provide is an idea and implementation/methodology that makes sense. If you do have your own engineering resources though, great! That will expedite the entire process.

3/ Methodologists act as the initializer of the strategy or, in the case that there is some active management required, a data oracle to the Coop.

The ability to write code is not required -- the engineers at Set Labs are investing time into helping launch products.

2/ The Methodologist program allocates 7.5% of all $INDEX tokens to be distributed monthly to Methodologists pro-rata based on the amount of revenue they generate for the Coop.

This is ~42k tokens per month which at current $INDEX prices, nets out to ~$210k distributed monthly.

1/ A core goal of the Index Coop is that we want to work with the best brands & brightest people to create insanely great products.

7/ Weâ€™re excited to watch all of the discussions unfold around this proposal and we believe that the Aave community will find a lot of value in adding a Set Protocol market to the protocol.

Be sure to join the Index Coop Discord here: https://t.co/kacqmkN7u1

6/ There are 2 key risks to including the $DPI in Aave: counterparty risk and market risk. Please read the proposal for a breakdown of these risks.

The proposal also contains additional details on what we believe the risk interest rate and risk parameters should be for the $DPI

5/ Minting/redeeming represent the primary market of the indices, but many users can buy and sell indices on the secondary markets (e.g. @uniswap) 

The Net Asset Value of the $DPI is kept in check by market makers that redeem the tokens when price is below NAV and vice versa

4/ Adding an index product as collateral also gives users exposure to all of the component tokens while only having to add in a single token - this saves gas for users when using the Aave protocol.

It also simplifies the overall user experience.

3/ With the inclusion of $DPI into Aave, users would gain the ability to both lend out their $DPI to earn a yield on it or use it as collateral and have the ability to borrow $DPI in order to short it or perform a carry trade.

2/ We believe that Sets act as better collateral than any individual token since the risk is diversified.

We also believe that the $DPI itself is exceptional collateral due to its low volatility nature as compared to any individual DeFi token.

1/ Weâ€™re excited to put forward a proposal to the @aaveaave community to add support for a @SetProtocol market - where we imagine the 1st asset supported to be the @defipulse Index with others added later.

Community / Native Token Holders. On top of monetary incentives, community members through holding underlying tokens may hold incredible leverage and power in influencing protocol decision-making (which may make native tokens like $INDEX increasingly desirable)

Protocols / Projects. Inclusion into an index represents an easy way to quickly acquire long-term holders and represents a huge vote in confidence for the protocol.

Short Term Traders. These folks may use index products to hedge/short, provide liquidity to capture fees, or perform creation/redemption arbitrages. These products represent huge opportunities for yield and profits.

Holders. Retail and institutional folks look to index products for easy, diversified exposure. This saves them time, effort, and allows for an unbiased portfolio.

7/ During the transitionary period, the Set team has the ability to make technical and safety-related decisions via multisig before governance is transitioned completely on-chain and over to the community.

6/ The Index Coop will follow the principles of progressive decentralization. To that end and to ensure a safe and secure transition that allows the community time to adopt governance responsibilities, there will be an initial transitionary period.

5/ A liquidity mining program is being launched at 12:00PM PDT on October 7th, 2020 that will allocate 9% of all INDEX tokens to those who provide liquidity to the DPI/ETH Uniswap pair and stake their LP tokens on the Index Coop website. This program will last for 60 days.
